properties.description: Accessible entrance Free Wi-fi Free devices to use Free use of computers Charging facilities for phones and other devices Hot drinks, cordial and biscuits Toilets Disabled Toilets Baby changing facilities Activities Car parking   Birchfield Community Association (Birchfield Big Local) is a resident-led organisation and registered charity (Charity No: 1193147). Based at Wilton Road United Reformed Church, the organisation provides a range of activities across the week including arts and crafts activities for young people with learning disabilities (in partnership with ATHAC CIC), IT and English Classes (with Birmingham Adult Education Service), a Seniors group and Women’s group, and a Job Club (in partnership with New Beginnings Creative CIC).  The organisation is also part of B-CAN – Energy – a collaboration between five organisations in North Birmingham providing advice and support to households on energy saving measures and reducing utility bills, and also FLOURISH – a collaborative of organisations in West Birmingham working to improve health and wellbeing.
properties.title: Birchfield Community Association

Tuesdays, 11.00-12.30 Keep Fit for over 50s with ‘Mr Handsworth’. Thursdays, 11.15-12.30 Make & Take craft session for adults with Monica Pierre - £2.00 Per Session. Fridays, 11.00-12.00 Under 5s Storytime. Fridays, 10.30-12.00 (last Friday of the month) Coffee Morning. Fridays, 10.30-12.00 (second Friday of the month; starting on 11th August) Alzheimer’s Society ‘Singing for the Brain’ and Dementia Adviser support and advice. Fridays, 14.00-15.30 BIPC – one to one business and intellectual property advice sessions. Saturdays, 14.30-16.30 Instilling Brilliance – anger management sessions for 14–16-year-olds.    One-Off/Special Events: Saturday 24th June, 11.00-13.00 Windrush 75 Celebration. Saturday 8th July, annual Summer Reading Challenge for children begins. Saturday 12th August, 11.00-12.30 BCAT (Birmingham Centre for Art Therapies) Summer Reading Challenge (SRC) workshop. Saturday 26th August, 11.00-12.30 BCAT SRC workshop. Friday 1st September – Thursday 30th November, ‘Life of a People’ photographic exhibition. Saturday 23rd September, 14.30-15.45 SRC awards ceremony and ‘Juggling Jim Circus Show’. October, Black History Month food-tasting event (date/time TBC). Thursday 5th October, National Poetry Day poetry performance (date/time TBC). October-December, Ikon Gallery photographic exhibition.

properties.title: Wylde Green United Reformed Church

properties.address: Clifton Road, Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, B73 6EB
properties.description: Accessible entrance One hour of free access to the swimming pool or gym (see below) Additional paid activities Shower facilities Toilets, including accessible toilets and baby-changing facilities Somewhere to park your car To become a member of be active (gym/swimming) you will need two forms of ID with your name and address on. The following will be accepted: • council tax bill – paid to Birmingham City Council • utility bill • tenancy agreement • driving licence • bank statement • benefit statement • medical card For customers living in residential hostels or similar communal accommodation, a letter on official letterhead confirming residential status and signed by the manager of the accommodation is acceptable. Gym: Monday to Sunday, 11am to midday Swimming: Monday to Wednesday, 10:30am to 11:30am // Thursday, 2:30pm to 3:30pm // Friday, 11am to midday // Saturday and Sunday, 7am to 8am
